channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024030645
item.description:
Report X-2024030645

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. OUTER BOX IS MARKED WITH ARROWS, FRAGILE, AND STICKER:" CONTAINS ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL". JUG INSIDE IS ONE GALLON OF 99% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL. LOOSE LOCKING CAP, LIQUID LEAKING OUT.

item.title: Report X-2024030538
item.description:
Report X-2024030538

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: STEEL DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED IN TO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL PPE/TUBS WERE DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED.

item.title: Report X-2024030489
item.description:
Report X-2024030489

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed a white residue coming out of the bottom. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the box was set inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2024030577
item.description:
Report X-2024030577

  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT WORK TO SEE A PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB ON THE RESPONDER DESK. LOOKING AT THE PACKAGE RESPONDER NOTICED THE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL. DONNING PPE RESPONDER THEN PROCESSED THE LEAKING PACKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024030272
item.description:
Report X-2024030272

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer then brought to QA when it was noticed box was damp, box was placed in red hazmat tote DescribePack: Cap is loose causing liquid to spill from top DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in red hazmat tote and isolated from other boxes to reduce spillage
